ESCOM organization.description: Learn about ESCOM structure and participation

Getting involved.question: How can I get involved with ESCOM?
Getting involved.answer: You can join ESCOM by participating in our coastal monitoring programs. Contact your local team coordinator or visit our website to register as a citizen scientist.

Benefits of participation.question: What are the benefits of participating in ESCOM?
Benefits of participation.answer: Benefits include contributing to environmental research, learning about coastal ecosystems, connecting with other scientists, and helping protect marine environments.

Organizational structure.question: How is ESCOM organized?
Organizational structure.answer: ESCOM is organized into regional teams, each focusing on specific coastal areas. We have team coordinators, data analysts, and citizen scientists working together.

Monitoring.description: Learn about monitoring protocols and instruments

Parameters.question: What parameters do we monitor?
Parameters.answer: We monitor water quality, temperature, salinity, pH levels, and other environmental parameters that affect coastal ecosystems.

Field protocols.question: What are the field monitoring protocols?
Field protocols.answer: Field protocols include standardized sampling methods, safety procedures, and data recording guidelines to ensure consistent and reliable data collection.

Instruments.question: What instruments do we use for monitoring?
Instruments.answer: We use various instruments including thermometers, pH meters, salinity meters, water quality sensors, and GPS devices for location tracking.

Wiki.question: Where can I find the training wiki?
Wiki.answer: Our training wiki is available online and contains comprehensive guides, tutorials, and best practices for coastal monitoring.

Manuals.question: Are there training manuals available?
Manuals.answer: Yes, we provide detailed training manuals covering all aspects of coastal monitoring, from basic procedures to advanced techniques.

Podcasts.question: Do you offer training podcasts?
Podcasts.answer: Yes, we have a series of training podcasts covering various topics in coastal monitoring and environmental science.

Videos.question: Are there training videos available?
Videos.answer: We offer comprehensive video training materials demonstrating proper monitoring techniques and equipment usage.

External references.question: What external references do you recommend?
External references.answer: We recommend various scientific journals, government reports, and educational resources for additional learning.

Data.description: Learn about data entry, visualization, and sharing

Entry.question: How do I enter monitoring data?
Entry.answer: Data can be entered through our mobile app, web interface, or by submitting paper forms to your team coordinator.

Download.question: How can I download my data?
Download.answer: You can download your data through the dashboard in various formats including CSV, Excel, and PDF reports.

Visualize.question: How can I visualize my data?
Visualize.answer: Our platform provides various visualization tools including charts, graphs, and maps to help you understand your data.

Property and sharing.question: Who owns the data I collect?
Property and sharing.answer: Data collected through ESCOM is shared for scientific research while protecting your privacy. You retain rights to your personal contributions.

Partners.description: Learn about our partners and collaborators

Dalhousie.question: What is our partnership with Dalhousie University?
Dalhousie.answer: Dalhousie University provides scientific expertise, research support, and academic validation for our monitoring programs.

ESCOM members.question: Who are the ESCOM members?
ESCOM members.answer: ESCOM members include citizen scientists, researchers, educators, and community leaders committed to coastal monitoring.

Funders.question: Who funds ESCOM activities?
Funders.answer: ESCOM is funded through various sources including government grants, private donations, and research partnerships.

Allies.question: Who are our allies and collaborators?
Allies.answer: Our allies include environmental organizations, research institutions, government agencies, and community groups.
